intro: Talisia dwyeri, commonly known as the Dwyer's talisia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or white. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
